prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.
original_avatar: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response.png
swipes:
Here is some background about Stefan, Suzanne, and Melissa:

Stefan and Suzanne are both in their early forties and both natives of Munich, Germany. They got married in April of 2016, eight years ago. Together, they have two daughters. The oldest is seven years old. The other is five years old.

Melissa is a woman that met Stefan and Suzanne four months ago when she traveled to Munich with her soon-to-be-ex-husband, Edward. Edward is Stefan's cousin. There was strong connection between Melissa and Stefan, although they did not act on it, and maintain respectful boundaries.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: Will Suzanne file for divorce in her marriage to Stefan?

Stefan should be represented by the Ascendant's 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

Due to the lack of planets in the 9th house, Stefan should be represented by the house ruler, Mars. Suzanne would be represented by Jupiter, in the ascendants 4th house(Stefan's 7th).

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Below is a list of the key chart data extracted from the horary chart for the query “Will Suzanne file for divorce in her marriage to Stefan?” using strict horary principles:

1. General Chart Setup
 • Ascendant (Inquirer/Melissa): 10° Aquarius
 • The chart is structured as a Bowl shape with an Air-dominant inner planet configuration and an empty top‑right quadrant.
 • Special patterns noted:
  – Stellium in Aquarius: Ascendant, Sun, Mercury, and Pluto all clustered in Aquarius.
  – Cradle: featuring the MC (2° Sagittarius), IC (2° Gemini), North Node (29° Pisces), Pluto (2° Aquarius), and Venus (2° Aries).

2. Representative Assignments
 • Inquirer (Melissa): Represented by the Ascendant and its immediate supports.
 • Stefan: As the Ascendant’s 9th house (foreign/partner area) is empty, he is represented by the house ruler – here designated as Mars.
  – Mars is retrograde in Cancer at 18°47′, placed in the 6th House.
 • Suzanne: Represented by Jupiter because she occupies the Ascendant’s 4th house (Stefan’s 7th in this context).
  – Jupiter is in Gemini at 11°17′, located in the 4th House (which also contains the Moon).

3. Planetary Placements by House and Sign
 • 1st House (10° Aquarius):
  – Sun at 18°58′ Aquarius
  – Mercury at 17°29′ Aquarius
  – Saturn at 18°8′ (in Aquarius, included in the Ascendant cluster)
  – Neptune at 28°9′ Pisces (in 1st House by given placement)
 • 2nd House (starting at 29° Pisces):
  – Venus at 2°15′ Aries
  – North Node at 29°30′ Pisces (retrograde)
  – Chiron at 19°42′ Aries
 • 3rd House (starting at 9° Taurus):
  – Uranus at 23°17′ Taurus
 • 4th House (starting at 2° Gemini):
  – Moon at 17°4′ Gemini
  – Jupiter at 11°17′ Gemini
 • 6th House (starting at 9° Cancer):
  – Mars (representing Stefan) at 18°47′ Cancer, retrograde
 • 12th House (starting at 9° Capricorn):
  – Pluto at 2°15′ Aquarius (forming part of the stellium due to its degree)

4. Major Aspects (Orb values as noted)
 • Mars—Saturn: Trine (orb 0°)
 • Mars—Chiron: Square (orb 1°)
 • Mars—Uranus: Sextile (orb 5°)
 • Jupiter—Moon: Conjunction (orb 6°)
 • Jupiter—Mercury: Trine (orb 6°)
 • Jupiter—Sun: Trine (orb 7°)
 • Mercury—Uranus: Square (orb 6°)
 • Sun—Uranus: Square (orb 5°)
 • Additional aspects in the chart include multiple favorable trines and sextiles among the Ascendant cluster, along with several key conjunctions (e.g., Sun–Mercury at orb 1°, Mercury–Ascendant at orb 7°, and Pluto–Ascendant at orb 8°).

5. Additional Notable Factors
 • The Moon is positioned in Gemini in the 4th House, reinforcing Suzanne’s representative area.
 • The inquirer’s chart shows considerable Aquarian energy via the stellium, placing emphasis on rationality and unconventional perspectives.
 • With Mars (Stefan) in Cancer and retrograde, attention is drawn to internal adjustments and hesitations regarding his role or actions in the matter.
 • Jupiter (Suzanne) in Gemini in the 4th House connects with family and marital matters, and its aspects (e.g., conjunction with the Moon and trines with other key planets) provide additional color.

This compilation of positions, aspects, and patterns forms the foundation for moving into the interpretive phase under strict horary principles.

 • Special patterns noted:
  – Stellium in Aquarius: Ascendant, Sun, Mercury, and Pluto all clustered in Aquarius.
  – Cradle: featuring the MC (2° Sagittarius), IC (2° Gemini), North Node (29° Pisces), Pluto (2° Aquarius), and Venus (2° Aries).

2. Representative Assignments
 • Inquirer (Melissa): Represented by the Ascendant and its immediate supports.
 • Stefan: As the Ascendant’s 9th house (foreign/partner area) is empty, he is represented by the house ruler – here designated as Mars.

  – Venus at 2°15′ Aries

  – Chiron at 19°42′ Aries

 • 4th House (starting at 2° Gemini):

  – Jupiter at 11°17′ Gemini
 • 6th House (starting at 9° Cancer):

 • 12th House (starting at 9° Capricorn):
  – Pluto at 2°15′ Aquarius (forming part of the stellium due to its degree)

4. Major Aspects (Orb values as noted)

5. Additional Notable Factors
 • The Moon is positioned in Gemini in the 4th House, reinforcing Suzanne’s representative area.
 • The inquirer’s chart shows considerable Aquarian energy via the stellium, placing emphasis on rationality and unconventional perspectives.
 • With Mars (Stefan) in Cancer and retrograde, attention is drawn to internal adjustments and hesitations regarding his role or actions in the matter.
 • Jupiter (Suzanne) in Gemini in the 4th House connects with family and marital matters, and its aspects (e.g., conjunction with the Moon and trines with other key planets) provide additional color.

This compilation of positions, aspects, and patterns forms the foundation for moving into the interpretive phase under strict horary principles.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Esmeralda Blackwood
mes:
Reviewing the horary data with strict adherence to traditional principles, the following emerges:

1. Representation of Parties
 • The inquirer (Melissa) is affirmed by the Ascendant in Aquarius.
 • Stefan is represented by Mars—the ruler of the Ascendant’s 9th house—found in Cancer and retrograde in the 6th house. This retrogression implies internal hesitancy and delays in matters concerning his role or actions.
 • Suzanne is represented by Jupiter, occupying the 4th house (the domicile for domestic affairs and partnership as mapped here). Jupiter in Gemini denotes a mutable and inconsistent quality, suggesting that while Suzanne’s emotions and opinions may shift, there is no forceful drive toward immediate action.

2. Chart Dynamics and Aspects
 • The Aquarian stellium (Sun, Mercury, Saturn, and Pluto) on the Ascendant emphasizes a rational, unconventional approach to personal matters. This energy tends toward analysis and measured responses rather than impulsive decisions.
 • Mars in Cancer, being retrograde and placed in the 6th house, points to inner conflict and a lack of aggressive forward movement. Its aspects—a favorable trine to Saturn but a challenging square to Chiron—signal a balance between discipline and lingering personal wounds, which may undercut decisive moves regarding marital matters.
 • Jupiter’s placement in Gemini, although receiving supportive aspects (trines with the Sun and Mercury), is weakened by its natural detriment in this mutable sign, indicating that Suzanne’s disposition towards change is marked by uncertainty rather than resolution.
 • The Moon’s location in the 4th house reinforces the emotional ties connected to home and domestic life. The Moon’s conjunction with Jupiter, even at a wider orb, enhances the emotional responsiveness of Suzanne’s representative but does not compel a sharp, unilateral action.

3. Interpretation of the Outcome
 • The absence of harsh or severely afflicting aspects targeting Jupiter suggests that, despite the undercurrents of tension, there is no strong impetus for Suzanne to take the drastic step of filing for divorce at this time.
 • Mars’s retrograde motion alongside its supportive trine to Saturn implies an environment of internal reassessment on Stefan’s part rather than overt conflict that might otherwise prompt a decisive legal action.
 • The overall configuration reflects a state of cautious re-evaluation and lingering indecision regarding the marital situation. The patterns indicate that while there is noticeable strain and susceptibility to change, the energies present do not favor an immediate filing of divorce by Suzanne.

Based on these factors, the indication is that Suzanne is unlikely to file for divorce on her own initiative under the current chart conditions.
